question: 8 apples are shared between 4 friends. How many apples will each friend get?
explanation: If you have 8 apples to share with 4 friends, you want each friend to get the same amount of apples. Start by giving each friend one apple at a time until the apples are gone. Each friend will end up with 2 apples.

question: 10 cookies are shared between 2 friends. How many cookies does each friend get?
explanation: To share 10 cookies equally between 2 friends, give each friend one cookie at a time until all the cookies are shared. When you finish sharing, each friend will have 5 cookies.

question: 6 balloons are shared between 3 kids. How many balloons does each kid get?
explanation: If you have 6 balloons to share equally with 3 kids, start by giving each kid one balloon at a time. Keep sharing until each kid has an equal amount. Each kid will end up with 2 balloons.

question: 12 marbles are shared among 4 kids. How many marbles does each kid get?
explanation: To share 12 marbles equally among 4 kids, give each kid one marble at a time until you have shared all of them. After sharing all the marbles, each kid will have 3 marbles.

question: There are 4 pencils. You want to share them with 2 friends. How many pencils does each friend get?
explanation: If you want to share 4 pencils with 2 friends so each friend gets an equal amount, give each friend one pencil at a time until you run out. Each friend will get 2 pencils in the end.
